item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Menopause is a peculiar human feature that fascinates evolutionary biologists. But now it turns out that female chimpanzees go through menopause, too. Here‚Äôs my story on this new mystery https://tinyurl.com/efkrhsnd [Gift link]

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Does your band co-author papers?Harnessing the Power of Music to Improve Emotional Health in OncologyJeffrey Peppercorn (guitar), Earl K. Miller (bass), and Michael E. Hasselmo (keys)

item.title: evacide
item.description: This report about how Kaspersky found and tracked down all of the elements of a persistent campaign to compromise to their Apple devices is a romp: https://securelist.com/operation-triangulation-catching-wild-triangle/110916/

item.title: Paolo Pozzi
item.description:
Oh, wow, what a warm reception! the fediverse science community may be small but is definitely welcoming!
As many suggested, here is my #introduction : I am a physicist developing optical microscopy methods for biomedical applications at the Politecnico di Milano University, in Italy. I will try to fill the fediverse with colorful images of squishy biological things. Apparently, I am also the new resident #opendata manager, so expect some posts on that!
#microscopy #lightsheet #optics

item.title: Theresa Desrochers
item.description: Come be my colleague!The Dept of Neuroscience at Brown University is hiring! A tenure-track Assistant Professor position is available for neuroscientists focusing in any topical area. If you wish to join our inclusive community of dedicated scholars & educators, info & apply @ apply.interfolio.com/132440#neuroscience #neuro #job #academia

item.title: leyrer
item.description: Repeat after me: Microsoft and Google are actively working on destroying the best federated communication medium we have - email.Since 17 October, to our knowledge any email with the NewClimate URL is unjustifiably quarantined by Microsoft email servers without any notice.https://newclimate.org/news/microsoft-error-or-external-attack-causing-disruption-to-email-communication-across-the

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: People of Boston! I‚Äôll be giving a talk on Monday in the Science on Screen series at the Coolidge Corner Theater. My talk is on the strange science of aging and immortality‚Äîpaired with a screening of the 1992 black comedy ‚ÄúDeath Becomes Her.‚Äù Details here: https://coolidge.org/films/death-becomes-her

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description:
#ComplexityThoughts issue #18 is out: amazing new papers, from #ComplexSystems foundations to #BioInspiredComputing #EvolutionaryDynamics #CollectiveBehavior & #NeuroscienceUnraveling complexity: building knowledge, one paper at a time!
Not yet subscribed? It's never too late, and it's 100% free.https://manlius.substack.com/p/complexity-thoughts-issue-18

item.title: Prof Aman Saleem
item.description: New POST-DOC & Tech positions in http://saleemlab.com funded by @ERC_Research & UKRI. Come join our exciting research program at UCL: how the brain learns to represent space. Lots of cool tools (rodent VR, AR - Neuropixels, head-mounted 2p) and great people. (Please Boost)Please feel free to reach out you want more details regarding the positions (I'll be @sfn in DC if you want to chat there)

item.title: Lili Saintcrow
item.description: "A female Jewish physicist was responsible for the single most important scientific discovery of the twentieth century. Her work has, literally, changed the world. Why isn‚Äôt her face staring out of every science textbook?" https://lithub.com/the-past-and-present-of-writing-women-out-of-scientific-history/

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description: Looking for: complex systems that defy model reduction.The behavior of a complex system is hard to predict from its parts alone because it follows from how the parts interact.Model reduction is a way to capture the behavior of a complex system more simply (eg to capture the magnetism of 1g of Fe2O3, you don't have to model all 1022 molecules and their interactions). My sense is that model reduction works best when you have many repeated copies.I'm looking for some good (ideally concrete) examples of complex systems that defy model reduction. I anticipate that they will be made of heterogeneous parts.Thanks in advance!#complexity
